verses.text: And again the anger of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* was kindled against Israel , and he moved David against them to say , Go , number Israel and Judah.

For the king said to Joab the captain of the host , which \add was\add* with him, Go now through all the tribes of Israel , from Dan even to Beer-sheba , and number ye the people , that I may know the number of the people.\f + \fr 24.2 \ft Go: or, Compass\f*

And Joab said unto the king , Now the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy God add unto the people , how many soever they be, an hundredfold , and that the eyes of my lord the king may see \add it:\add* but why doth my lord the king delight in this thing ?

Notwithstanding the king’s word prevailed against Joab , and against the captains of the host. And Joab and the captains of the host went out from the presence of the king , to number the people of Israel. \p
¶ And they passed over Jordan , and pitched in Aroer , on the right side of the city that \add lieth\add* in the midst of the river of Gad , and toward Jazer :\f + \fr 24.5 \ft river: or, valley\f*
Then they came to Gilead , and to the land of Tahtim-hodshi ; and they came to Dan-jaan , and about to Zidon ,\f + \fr 24.6 \ft land of Tahtim-hodshi: or, nether land newly inhabited\f*
And came to the strong hold of Tyre , and to all the cities of the Hivites , and of the Canaanites : and they went out to the south of Judah , \add even\add* to Beer-sheba.
So when they had gone through all the land , they came to Jerusalem at the end of nine months and twenty days.

And Joab gave up the sum of the number of the people unto the king : and there were in Israel eight hundred thousand valiant men that drew the sword ; and the men of Judah \add were\add* five hundred thousand men. \p

¶ And David’s heart smote him after that he had numbered the people. And David said unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, I have sinned greatly in that I have done : and now, I beseech thee, O 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, take away the iniquity of thy servant ; for I have done very foolishly.
For when David was up in the morning , the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* came unto the prophet Gad , David’s seer , saying ,
Go and say unto David , Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, I offer thee three \add things;\add* choose thee one of them, that I may \add do it\add* unto thee.

So Gad came to David , and told him, and said unto him, Shall seven years of famine come unto thee in thy land ? or wilt thou flee three months before thine enemies , while they pursue thee? or that there be three days’ pestilence in thy land ? now advise , and see what answer I shall return to him that sent me.

And David said unto Gad , I am in a great strait : let us fall now into the hand of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; for his mercies \add are\add* great : and let me not fall into the hand of man.\f + \fr 24.14 \ft are great: or, are many\f* \p
¶ So the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* sent a pestilence upon Israel from the morning even to the time appointed : and there died of the people from Dan even to Beer-sheba seventy thousand men.

And when the angel stretched out his hand upon Jerusalem to destroy it, the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* repented him of the evil , and said to the angel that destroyed the people , It is enough : stay now thine hand. And the angel of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* was by the threshingplace of Araunah the Jebusite.  +  r 24.16  t Araunah: also called, Ornan *

And David spake unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* when he saw the angel that smote the people , and said , Lo, I have sinned , and I have done wickedly : but these sheep , what have they done ? let thine hand , I pray thee, be against me, and against my father’s house. \p

¶ And Gad came that day to David , and said unto him, Go up , rear an altar unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* in the threshingfloor of Araunah the Jebusite.\f + \fr 24.18 \ft Araunah: Heb. Araniah\f*
And David , according to the saying of Gad , went up as the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* commanded.
And Araunah looked , and saw the king and his servants coming on toward him: and Araunah went out , and bowed himself before the king on his face upon the ground.

And Araunah said , Wherefore is my lord the king come to his servant ? And David said , To buy the threshingfloor of thee, to build an altar unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, that the plague may be stayed from the people.

And Araunah said unto David , Let my lord the king take and offer up what \add seemeth\add* good unto him : behold , \add here be\add* oxen for burnt sacrifice , and threshing instruments and \add other\add* instruments of the oxen for wood.
All these \add things\add* did Araunah , \add as\add* a king , give unto the king. And Araunah said unto the king , The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy God accept thee.

And the king said unto Araunah , Nay; but I will surely buy \add it\add* of thee at a price : neither will I offer burnt offerings unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* my God of that which doth cost me nothing. So David bought the threshingfloor and the oxen for fifty shekels of silver.

And David built there an altar unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings. So the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* was intreated for the land , and the plague was stayed from Israel.
